trans-unit.source: Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this journal? You will lose any customizations you have made.
trans-unit.target: Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this journal? You will lose any customizations you have made.

trans-unit.source: Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a journal to be viewed and manipulated directly.
trans-unit.target: Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a journal to be viewed and manipulated directly.

trans-unit.source: This will replace any locale-specific journal settings you had for this locale
trans-unit.target: This will replace any locale-specific journal settings you had for this locale

trans-unit.source:
OJS can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OJS can operate as a multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in several additional languages.
If a language supported by OJS is not listed below, ask your site administrator to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OJS documentation.
trans-unit.target:
OJS can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OJS can operate as a multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in several additional languages.
If a language supported by OJS is not listed below, ask your site administrator to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OJS documentation.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your site administrator if you wish to use additional languages with this journal.
trans-unit.target: Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your site administrator if you wish to use additional languages with this journal.

trans-unit.source: This will be the default language for the journal site.
trans-unit.target: This will be the default language for the journal site.

trans-unit.source: Enter fee amounts below in order to enable author processing charges.
trans-unit.target: Enter fee amounts below in order to enable author processing charges.

trans-unit.source: OJS does not perform any currency conversions. If accepting payments for subscriptions, you must ensure that the subscription currency matches the one specified here.
trans-unit.target: OJS does not perform any currency conversions. If accepting payments for subscriptions, you must ensure that the subscription currency matches the one specified here.

trans-unit.source: All costs must be positive numeric values (decimal points are allowed)
trans-unit.target: All costs must be positive numeric values (decimal points are allowed)

trans-unit.source: The Association Membership will appear in About the Journal under Policies, and the donations link will appear above the search function in the right-hand frame.
trans-unit.target: The Association Membership will appear in About the Journal under Policies, and the donations link will appear above the search function in the right-hand frame.

trans-unit.source: This will activate payments for Subscriptions, where types, cost, duration and subscriptions are managed by the Journal (Subscription) Manager.
trans-unit.target: This will activate payments for Subscriptions, where types, cost, duration and subscriptions are managed by the Journal (Subscription) Manager.

trans-unit.source: Are you sure you wish to delete this subscription?
trans-unit.target: Are you sure you wish to delete this subscription?

trans-unit.source: Payments will be enabled for this journal. Note that users will be required to log in to make payments.
trans-unit.target: Payments will be enabled for this journal. Note that users will be required to log in to make payments.

trans-unit.source: Only Restrict Access to PDF version of issues and articles
trans-unit.target: Only Restrict Access to PDF version of issues and articles

trans-unit.source: You may configure any of the following Payment Method Plugins from this screen.
trans-unit.target: You may configure any of the following Payment Method Plugins from this screen.

trans-unit.source: Selected options, along with their descriptions and fees (which can be edited below), will appear in About the Journal under Policies, as well as at points where payment is required.
trans-unit.target: Selected options, along with their descriptions and fees (which can be edited below), will appear in About the Journal under Policies, as well as at points where payment is required.

trans-unit.source: Enroll a User from this Site in this Journal
trans-unit.target: Enroll a User from this Site in this Journal

trans-unit.source: Remove this user from this journal? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this journal.
trans-unit.target: Remove this user from this journal? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this journal.

trans-unit.source: Select a user (or several) to merge into another user account (e.g., when someone has two user accounts). The account(s) selected first will be deleted and any submissions, assignments, etc. will be attributed to the second account.
trans-unit.target: Select a user (or several) to merge into another user account (e.g., when someone has two user accounts). The account(s) selected first will be deleted and any submissions, assignments, etc. will be attributed to the second account.

trans-unit.source: Select a user to whom to attribute the previous users' authorships, editing assignments, etc.
trans-unit.target: Select a user to whom to attribute the previous users' authorships, editing assignments, etc.

trans-unit.source: Enrollment synchronization will enroll all users enrolled in the specified role in the specified journal into the same role in this journal. This function allows a common set of users (e.g., Reviewers) to be synchronized between journals.
trans-unit.target: Enrollment synchronization will enroll all users enrolled in the specified role in the specified journal into the same role in this journal. This function allows a common set of users (e.g., Reviewers) to be synchronized between journals.

trans-unit.source: There are no section editors yet. Add this role to at least one user via Management > Settings > Users & Roles first.
trans-unit.target: There are no section editors yet. Add this role to at least one user via Management > Settings > Users & Roles first.

trans-unit.source: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this section?
trans-unit.target: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this section?

trans-unit.source: Before this section can be deleted, you must move articles published within it into other sections.
trans-unit.target: Before this section can be deleted, you must move articles published within it into other sections.

trans-unit.source: Add a Section Editor to this section to have submissions automatically assigned to the Section Editor. (Otherwise, Section Editors can be assigned manually, after a submission comes in.) If added, a Section Editor can be automatically assigned to oversee the REVIEW (peer review) and/or the EDITING (copyediting, layout and proofreading) of submissions to this section. Section Editors are created by clicking Section Editors under Roles in Journal Management.
trans-unit.target: Add a Section Editor to this section to have submissions automatically assigned to the Section Editor. (Otherwise, Section Editors can be assigned manually, after a submission comes in.) If added, a Section Editor can be automatically assigned to oversee the REVIEW (peer review) and/or the EDITING (copyediting, layout and proofreading) of submissions to this section. Section Editors are created by clicking Section Editors under Roles in Journal Management.

trans-unit.source: Items can only be submitted by Editors and Section Editors.
trans-unit.target: Items can only be submitted by Editors and Section Editors.

trans-unit.source: An abbreviated title is required for the section
trans-unit.target: An abbreviated title is required for the section

trans-unit.source: Please ensure that at least one checkbox is checked for each Section Editor assignment.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure that at least one checkbox is checked for each Section Editor assignment.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure that you have chosen a valid review form.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure that you have chosen a valid review form.

trans-unit.source: A title is required for the section.
trans-unit.target: A title is required for the section.

trans-unit.source: Omit author names for section items from issues' table of contents.
trans-unit.target: Omit author names for section items from issues' table of contents.

trans-unit.source: Omit the title of this section from issues' table of contents.
trans-unit.target: Omit the title of this section from issues' table of contents.

trans-unit.target: Identify items published in this section as a(n)

trans-unit.source: (For example, "Peer-reviewed Article", "Non-refereed Book Review", "Invited Commentary", etc.)
trans-unit.target: (For example, "Peer-reviewed Article", "Non-refereed Book Review", "Invited Commentary", etc.)

trans-unit.target: Will not be included in the indexing of the journal

trans-unit.target: Submissions made to this section of the journal

trans-unit.target: Limit abstract word counts for this section (0 for no limit)

trans-unit.source: List editors, managing directors, and other individuals associated with the journal.
trans-unit.target: List editors, managing directors, and other individuals associated with the journal.

trans-unit.source: The journal homepage consists of navigation links by default. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown.
trans-unit.target: The journal homepage consists of navigation links by default. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown.

trans-unit.source: Add Item to Appear in "About the Journal"
trans-unit.target: Add Item to Appear in "About the Journal"

trans-unit.source: Alternately, instead of title and logo, an HTML version of the header can be inserted into the text box below. Leave textbox blank if not required.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, instead of title and logo, an HTML version of the header can be inserted into the text box below. Leave textbox blank if not required.

trans-unit.source: Announcements may be published to inform readers of journal news and events. Published announcements will appear on the Announcements page.
trans-unit.target: Announcements may be published to inform readers of journal news and events. Published announcements will appear on the Announcements page.

trans-unit.target: Enter any additional information that should be displayed to readers on the Announcements page.

trans-unit.source: Require submitting Authors to file a Competing Interest (CI) statement with their submission.
trans-unit.target: Require submitting Authors to file a Competing Interest (CI) statement with their submission.

trans-unit.source: Require Reviewers to file a CI statement with each peer review they submit.
trans-unit.target: Require Reviewers to file a CI statement with each peer review they submit.

trans-unit.source: This text will appear in the "About" section of the journal website and can be used to describe changes in titles, editorial board, and other items of relevance to the journal's publication history.
trans-unit.target: This text will appear in the "About" section of the journal website and can be used to describe changes in titles, editorial board, and other items of relevance to the journal's publication history.

trans-unit.source: The Copyedit Instructions will be made available to Copyeditors, Authors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be modified or replaced by the Journal Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).
trans-unit.target: The Copyedit Instructions will be made available to Copyeditors, Authors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be modified or replaced by the Journal Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).

trans-unit.source: Refers to geo-spatial location, chronological or historical coverage, and/or characteristics of research sample.
trans-unit.target: Refers to geo-spatial location, chronological or historical coverage, and/or characteristics of research sample.

trans-unit.target: Custom HTML header tags to be inserted in the header of every page (e.g., META tags).

trans-unit.source: Name of journal, ISSN, contacts, sponsors, and search engines.
trans-unit.target: Name of journal, ISSN, contacts, sponsors, and search engines.

trans-unit.source: The Journal Manager will register all user accounts. Editors or Section Editors may register user accounts for reviewers.
trans-unit.target: The Journal Manager will register all user accounts. Editors or Section Editors may register user accounts for reviewers.

trans-unit.source: Useful when journal crosses disciplinary boundaries and/or authors submit multidisciplinary items.
trans-unit.target: Useful when journal crosses disciplinary boundaries and/or authors submit multidisciplinary items.

trans-unit.source: (E.g., History; Education; Sociology; Psychology; Cultural Studies; Law)
trans-unit.target: (E.g., History; Education; Sociology; Psychology; Cultural Studies; Law)

trans-unit.target: Provide examples of relevant academic disciplines for this journal

trans-unit.target: Add the table of contents for the current issue (if available).

trans-unit.target: Any undeliverable emails will result in an error message to this address.

trans-unit.source: Note: To activate this option, the site administrator must enable the allow_envelope_sender option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
trans-unit.target: Note: To activate this option, the site administrator must enable the allow_envelope_sender option in the OJS configuration file. trans-unit.target: Enable Journal Managers to add journal announcements.

trans-unit.source: of the most recent announcements on the journal homepage.

trans-unit.source: Visitors can register a user account with the journal.
trans-unit.target: Visitors can register a user account with the journal.

trans-unit.source: Describe to authors, readers, and librarians the range of articles and other items the journal will publish.
trans-unit.target: Describe to authors, readers, and librarians the range of articles and other items the journal will publish.

trans-unit.source: For Authors to Index Their Work
trans-unit.target: For Authors to Index Their Work

trans-unit.source: OJS adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The authors will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Journal Manager should select the categories for indexing and present authors with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work.
trans-unit.target: OJS adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The authors will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Journal Manager should select the categories for indexing and present authors with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work.

trans-unit.source: The specified ISSN is not valid.
trans-unit.target: The specified ISSN is not valid.

trans-unit.source: The primary contact email is required.
trans-unit.target: The primary contact email is required.

trans-unit.source: The primary contact name is required.
trans-unit.target: The primary contact name is required.

trans-unit.source: The number of reviewers per submission is required.
trans-unit.target: The number of reviewers per submission is required.

trans-unit.source: For journals that offer immediate or delayed open access, include a Creative Commons license with all published work at the appropriate time.
trans-unit.target: For journals that offer immediate or delayed open access, include a Creative Commons license with all published work at the appropriate time.

trans-unit.source: Brief descriptions of the journal for librarians and prospective authors and readers. These are made available in the site's sidebar when the Information block has been added.
trans-unit.target: Brief descriptions of the journal for librarians and prospective authors and readers. These are made available in the site's sidebar when the Information block has been added.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the format selected, identify the issue, volume, and/or year of the first issue to be published with OJS:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the format selected, identify the issue, volume, and/or year of the first issue to be published with OJS:

trans-unit.source: Navigation bar items can be added to the current set (Home, About, User Home, etc.) that appear at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Navigation bar items can be added to the current set (Home, About, User Home, etc.) that appear at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: A brief description of your journal that can be displayed in lists of journals.
trans-unit.target: A brief description of your journal that can be displayed in lists of journals.

trans-unit.source: Include any information about your journal which may be of interest to readers, authors or reviewers. This could include your open access policy, the focus and scope of the journal, copyright notice, sponsorship disclosure, history of the journal, a privacy statement, and inclusion in any LOCKSS or CLOCKSS archival system.
trans-unit.target: Include any information about your journal which may be of interest to readers, authors or reviewers. This could include your open access policy, the focus and scope of the journal, copyright notice, sponsorship disclosure, history of the journal, a privacy statement, and inclusion in any LOCKSS or CLOCKSS archival system.

trans-unit.source: Add a favicon for this journal to display alongside the navigation bar when users are visiting your site.
trans-unit.target: Add a favicon for this journal to display alongside the navigation bar when users are visiting your site.

trans-unit.source: Invalid favicon format. Accepted formats are .ico, .png, and .gif.
trans-unit.target: Invalid favicon format. Accepted formats are .ico, .png, and .gif.

trans-unit.source: By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown. Note that the current issue is always accessible through the Current link in the navigation bar.
trans-unit.target: By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown. Note that the current issue is always accessible through the Current link in the navigation bar.

trans-unit.source: A graphic version of the journal's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.
trans-unit.target: A graphic version of the journal's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.

trans-unit.source: Choose a journal theme and select layout components here. A journal stylesheet may also be uploaded, which can be used to override style data in the system-wide stylesheets and theme stylesheet (if a theme is chosen).
trans-unit.target: Choose a journal theme and select layout components here. A journal stylesheet may also be uploaded, which can be used to override style data in the system-wide stylesheets and theme stylesheet (if a theme is chosen).

trans-unit.source: This is the footer of your journal. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.
trans-unit.target: This is the footer of your journal. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.

trans-unit.source: Your journal setup has been updated.
trans-unit.target: Your journal setup has been updated.

trans-unit.source: Invalid journal stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.
trans-unit.target: Invalid journal stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.

trans-unit.source: A small logo or representation of the journal that can be used in lists of journals.
trans-unit.target: A small logo or representation of the journal that can be used in lists of journals.

trans-unit.source: Layout Instructions can be prepared for the formatting of publishing items in the journal and be entered below in HTML or plain text. They will be made available to the Layout Editor and Section Editor on the Editing page of each submission. (As each journal may employ its own file formats, bibliographic standards, style sheets, etc., a default set of instructions is not provided.)
trans-unit.target: Layout Instructions can be prepared for the formatting of publishing items in the journal and be entered below in HTML or plain text. They will be made available to the Layout Editor and Section Editor on the Editing page of each submission. (As each journal may employ its own file formats, bibliographic standards, style sheets, etc., a default set of instructions is not provided.)

trans-unit.source: Templates can be uploaded to appear in Layout for each of the standard formats published in the journal (e.g., article, book review, etc.) using any file format (e.g., pdf, doc, etc.) with annotations added specifying font, size, margins, etc. to serve as a guide for Layout Editors and Proofreaders.
trans-unit.target: Templates can be uploaded to appear in Layout for each of the standard formats published in the journal (e.g., article, book review, etc.) using any file format (e.g., pdf, doc, etc.) with annotations added specifying font, size, margins, etc. to serve as a guide for Layout Editors and Proofreaders.

trans-unit.source: Limit the number of items (for example, submissions, users, or editing assignments) to show in a list before showing subsequent items in another page. Also, limit the number of links to display to subsequent pages of the list.
trans-unit.target: Limit the number of items (for example, submissions, users, or editing assignments) to show in a list before showing subsequent items in another page. Also, limit the number of links to display to subsequent pages of the list.

trans-unit.source: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria.
trans-unit.target: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Settings link to accept the terms of use for the PKP PN.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Settings link to accept the terms of use for the PKP PN.

trans-unit.source: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria. The PKP PN plugin for OJS 3 is currently in development and will be available in the plugin gallery soon.
trans-unit.target: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria. The PKP PN plugin for OJS 3 is currently in development and will be available in the plugin gallery soon.

trans-unit.source: Enable LOCKSS to store and distribute journal content at participating libraries via a LOCKSS Publisher Manifest page.
trans-unit.target: Enable LOCKSS to store and distribute journal content at participating libraries via a LOCKSS Publisher Manifest page.

trans-unit.source: A LOCKSS license will appear in About the Journal under Archiving: LOCKSS License
trans-unit.target: A LOCKSS license will appear in About the Journal under Archiving: LOCKSS License

trans-unit.source: Identify 6-10 libraries that will register and cache the journal. For example, turn to institutions where editors or Board members work and/or institutions already participating in LOCKSS. See the LOCKSS community.
trans-unit.target: Identify 6-10 libraries that will register and cache the journal. For example, turn to institutions where editors or Board members work and/or institutions already participating in LOCKSS. See the LOCKSS community.

trans-unit.source: Enable CLOCKSS to store and distribute journal content at participating libraries via a CLOCKSS Publisher Manifest page.
trans-unit.target: Enable CLOCKSS to store and distribute journal content at participating libraries via a CLOCKSS Publisher Manifest page.

trans-unit.source: A CLOCKSS license will appear in About the Journal under Archiving: CLOCKSS License
trans-unit.target: A CLOCKSS license will appear in About the Journal under Archiving: CLOCKSS License

trans-unit.source: Sign up for the CLOCKSS service by visiting the CLOCKSS website.
trans-unit.target: Sign up for the CLOCKSS service by visiting the CLOCKSS website.

trans-unit.source: Enable Portico to store and distribute journal content to libraries participating in Portico.
trans-unit.target: Enable Portico to store and distribute journal content to libraries participating in Portico.

trans-unit.source: Homepage header, content, journal header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.
trans-unit.target: Homepage header, content, journal header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.

trans-unit.source: Access and security, scheduling, announcements, copyediting, layout, and proofreading.
trans-unit.target: Access and security, scheduling, announcements, copyediting, layout, and proofreading.

trans-unit.source: Add or remove additional navigation bar items.
trans-unit.target: Add or remove additional navigation bar items.

trans-unit.source: URL is an absolute URL (e.g., "http://www.example.com") rather than a path relative to the site (e.g., "/manager/setup")
trans-unit.target: URL is an absolute URL (e.g., "http://www.example.com") rather than a path relative to the site (e.g., "/manager/setup")

trans-unit.source: The label value is a literal string (e.g., "Journal Setup") rather than a localization message key (e.g., "manager.setup")
trans-unit.target: The label value is a literal string (e.g., "Journal Setup") rather than a localization message key (e.g., "manager.setup")

trans-unit.source: Note: The submission acknowledgement email is currently disabled. To use this feature, enable the "Submission Ack" email in Emails.
trans-unit.target: Note: The submission acknowledgement email is currently disabled. To use this feature, enable the "Submission Ack" email in Emails.

trans-unit.source: The journal will provide open access to its contents.
trans-unit.target: The journal will provide open access to its contents.

trans-unit.source: Focus, peer review, sections, privacy, security, and additional about items.
trans-unit.target: Focus, peer review, sections, privacy, security, and additional about items.

trans-unit.source: The Proofreading Instructions will be made available to Proofreaders, Authors, Layout Editors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be edited or replaced by the Journal Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).
trans-unit.target: The Proofreading Instructions will be made available to Proofreaders, Authors, Layout Editors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be edited or replaced by the Journal Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).

trans-unit.source: Journal items can be published collectively, as part of an issue with its own Table of Contents. Alternatively, individual items can be published as soon as they are ready, by adding them to the "current" volume's Table of Contents. Provide readers, in About the Journal, with a statement about the system this journal will use and its expected frequency of publication.
trans-unit.target: Journal items can be published collectively, as part of an issue with its own Table of Contents. Alternatively, individual items can be published as soon as they are ready, by adding them to the "current" volume's Table of Contents. Provide readers, in About the Journal, with a statement about the system this journal will use and its expected frequency of publication.

trans-unit.source: The name of the organization publishing the journal may be included in metadata provided to third-party archival bodies.
trans-unit.target: The name of the organization publishing the journal may be included in metadata provided to third-party archival bodies.

trans-unit.source: Users must be registered and log in to view open access content.
trans-unit.target: Users must be registered and log in to view open access content.

trans-unit.source: Users must be registered and log in to view the journal site.
trans-unit.target: Users must be registered and log in to view the journal site.

trans-unit.source: Provide reviewers with criteria for judging a submission's suitability for publication in the journal, which may include instructions for preparing an effective and helpful review. Reviewers will have an opportunity to provide comments intended for the author and editor, as well as separate comments only for the editor.
trans-unit.target: Provide reviewers with criteria for judging a submission's suitability for publication in the journal, which may include instructions for preparing an effective and helpful review. Reviewers will have an opportunity to provide comments intended for the author and editor, as well as separate comments only for the editor.

trans-unit.source: To activate these options, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
trans-unit.target: To activate these options, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.

trans-unit.source: Weeks allowed to complete the review
trans-unit.target: Weeks allowed to complete the review

trans-unit.source: Editors will rate reviewers on a five-point quality scale after each review.
trans-unit.target: Editors will rate reviewers on a five-point quality scale after each review.

trans-unit.source: Reviewers will have access to the submission file only after agreeing to review it.
trans-unit.target: Reviewers will have access to the submission file only after agreeing to review it.

trans-unit.source: Note: The email invitation to reviewers will contain a special URL that takes invited reviewers directly to the Review page for the submission (with access to any other pages requiring them to log in). For security reasons with this option, editors are not able to modify email addresses or add CCs or BCCs prior to sending invitations to reviewers.
trans-unit.target: Note: The email invitation to reviewers will contain a special URL that takes invited reviewers directly to the Review page for the submission (with access to any other pages requiring them to log in). For security reasons with this option, editors are not able to modify email addresses or add CCs or BCCs prior to sending invitations to reviewers.

trans-unit.source: Provide a brief description of the journal which search engines can display when listing the journal in search results.
trans-unit.target: Provide a brief description of the journal which search engines can display when listing the journal in search results.

trans-unit.source: (If sections are not added, then items are submitted to the Articles section by default.)
trans-unit.target: (If sections are not added, then items are submitted to the Articles section by default.)

To create or modify sections for the journal (e.g., Articles, Book Reviews, etc.), go to Section Management.
Authors on submitting items to the journal will designate...

To create or modify sections for the journal (e.g., Articles, Book Reviews, etc.), go to Section Management.

trans-unit.source: OJS provides a number of security-related options that can be used to restrict the journal's contents, and maintain additional information about submissions for auditing purposes.
trans-unit.target: OJS provides a number of security-related options that can be used to restrict the journal's contents, and maintain additional information about submissions for auditing purposes.

trans-unit.source: The journal editor who will see it through the editorial process.

trans-unit.source: On making a submission to the journal, authors are first asked to check each item on the Submission Preparation Checklist as completed, before proceeding. The checklist also appears in the Author Guidelines, under About the Journal. The list can be edited below, but all items on the list will require a checkmark before authors can proceed with their submission.

trans-unit.source: Your journal is configured to record more than one usage metric. Usage statistics will be displayed in several contexts. There are cases where a single usage statistic must be used, e.g. to display an ordered list of most-used articles or to rank search results. Please select one of the configured metrics as a default.
trans-unit.target: Your journal is configured to record more than one usage metric. Usage statistics will be displayed in several contexts. There are cases where a single usage statistic must be used, e.g. to display an ordered list of most-used articles or to rank search results. Please select one of the configured metrics as a default.

trans-unit.source: OJS calculates the following statistics for each journal. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.
trans-unit.target: OJS calculates the following statistics for each journal. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.

trans-unit.source:
If IP ranges are entered here, the domain is optional.
Valid values include an IP address (e.g. 142.58.103.1), IP range (e.g. 142.58.103.1 - 142.58.103.4), IP range with wildcard '*' (e.g. 142.58.*.*), and an IP range with CIDR (e.g. 142.58.100.0/24).
trans-unit.target:
If IP ranges are entered here, the domain is optional.

trans-unit.source: Articles within published issues of a journal are organized in Sections, typically by theme or content type (e.g. Review Articles, Research, etc).
trans-unit.target: Articles within published issues of a journal are organized in Sections, typically by theme or content type (e.g. Review Articles, Research, etc).

trans-unit.source: Roles are groups of users in the journal who are given access to different permission levels and associated workflows within the journal. There are five different permission levels: Journal Managers have access to everything in the journal (all content and settings); Section Editors have complete access to all assigned content; Journal Assistants have limited access to all submissions that have been explicitly assigned to them by an editor; Reviewers can see and perform the submissions they have been assigned to review; and Authors can see and interact with a limited amount of information on their own submissions. Additionally, there are five different stage assignments that roles may be given access to: Submission, Internal Review, Review, Editorial, and Production.
trans-unit.target: Roles are groups of users in the journal who are given access to different permission levels and associated workflows within the journal. There are five different permission levels: Journal Managers have access to everything in the journal (all content and settings); Section Editors have complete access to all assigned content; Journal Assistants have limited access to all submissions that have been explicitly assigned to them by an editor; Reviewers can see and perform the submissions they have been assigned to review; and Authors can see and interact with a limited amount of information on their own submissions. Additionally, there are five different stage assignments that roles may be given access to: Submission, Internal Review, Review, Editorial, and Production.
